modifiers.name: Diffuse
modifiers.notes: Immune to crippling injuries. Brain, Vitals and Groin cannot be targeted. Most foes cannot slam or grapple you (GM's decision). Do not bleed. Unaffected by blood-borne toxins. Immune to attacks that rely on cutting off blood to part of your body. Impaling and piercing attacks of any size never do more than 1 HP of injury, regardless of penetrating damage. Other attacks never do more than 2 HP of injury. Exception: Area-effect, cone, and explosion attacks cause normal injury

modifiers.name: Homogenous
modifiers.notes: Altered wound modifiers: imp & pi++ are x1/2, pi+ is x1/3, pi is x1/5, pi- is x1/10

modifiers.name: No Blood
modifiers.notes: Do not bleed, unaffected by blood-borne toxins, immune to attacks that rely on cutting off blood to part of your body

modifiers.name: No Brain
modifiers.notes: Brain cannot be targeted. Blows to the skull or eye are treated like blows to the face, except that eye injury can still cripple the eye

modifiers.name: No Eyes
modifiers.notes: Eyes may not be targeted. Immune to blinding attacks

modifiers.name: No Head
modifiers.notes: Skull, Brain and Face cannot be targeted

modifiers.name: No Neck
modifiers.notes: Neck may not be targeted and cannot be decapitated, choked or strangled

modifiers.name: No Vitals
modifiers.notes: Attacks to the Vitals or Groin are treated as attacks to the Torso

modifiers.name: Unliving
modifiers.notes: Altered wound modifiers: imp & pi++ are x1, pi+ is x1/2, pi is x1/3, pi- is x1/5

children.name: Impulsiveness
children.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever it would be wise to wait and ponder. If you fail, you must act

children.name: Overconfidence

features.situation: from young or naive individuals who believe you are as good as you say you are

children.notes: You must make a self-control roll any time the GM feels you show an unreasonable degree of caution. If you fail, you must go ahead as though you were able to handle the situation!

children.name: Pacifism: Cannot Harm Innocents
children.notes: You may fight – you may even start fights – but you may only use deadly force on a foe that is attempting to do you serious harm. Capture is not “serious harm” unless you are already under penalty of death or have a Code of Honor that would require suicide if captured. You never intentionally do anything that causes, or even threatens to cause, injury to the uninvolved – particularly if they are “ordinary folks.”

features.situation: from others except your own kind
from others of your own kind in an area, profession, or situation where your minority is especially rare

skills.name: 7 - Choose one additional Skill from the following list:

notes.text: 1,000 points You’re massively strong and deal out lots of damage; you also stand up to a lot of injury. Your combat style is brutally direct to match. Beyond your sheer physical toughness, you have the fortitude to go on fighting even when you’re taking a beating.
